column4: i'd hardly agree w/ that... most people who use ubuntu couldn't be a hacker if they were spotted the "hacke"
no, it still would be, don't fool yourself..lol
if kde was like a linux virus, it would be virtually nonexentient and very easy to get rid of!
i guess thats a matter of opinion.. :)
what is the wireless device on the pc?
it's a tp-link tl-wn727N usb adapter
and you said linux-compat-wireless, is already installed?
yes, but it doesn't seem to have it for the newest kernel, 2.6.32-28
I need this package: linux-backports-modules-compat-wireless-2.6.34-2.6.32-28-generic  and I can't seem to find it.
probably because youre not connected to the internet

I'm guessning I did as it shows linux-backports-modules-compat-wireless-2.6.34-2.6.32-26-generic and linux-backports-modules-compat-wireless-2.6.34-2.6.32-27-generic, just not linux-backports-modules-compat-wireless-2.6.34-2.6.32-28-generic.
that name/version, does not look right...
I still can't find it, any suggestions?  I've tried a web search, searching synaptic, etc. and I still can't find linux-backports-modules-compat-wireless-2.6.34-2.6.32-28-generic
not really sure to be honest, i figured that was the package you needed.
nope, i need the one for the newer kernel.  this is really wierd, mabey ndiswrapper will work..
